subject: Investing
title: When to Increase or Decrease Global Exposure
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on When to Increase or Decrease Global Exposure.

hook.text: After a decade of US dominance, many investors abandoned international stocks. Then global markets surged.

buildup.text: Valuation gaps between regions can signal when to tilt. Cheap markets often outperform over the next decade.

discovery.text: CAPE ratios compare regions on a level field. A lower CAPE suggests higher expected long-term returns.

twist.text: Tilting isn't timing. You're adjusting weights gradually based on valuation, not jumping in and out.

climax.text: Keep a stable core allocation and only adjust the edges when valuation extremes appear across regions.

punchline.text: Don't chase last decade's winner. Lean toward where value lives today.

quiz.question: What metric helps compare regional stock valuations?
